choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: If there is no motion to set an agenda item, a delegate can speak for 5 hours straight

choices.answer: False
True

questions.question: The point of information can be used to ask the chair about a Motion

choices.answer: No, it means that the committee is on voting procedure
No, that's a motion used only to go to the Delegate's Dance
Yes! The conference is over
No, to go home, we need to Adjourn the Meeting

questions.question: Can you go home when a suspension of the meeting is approved by the Committee?
Can the United States be only present instead of present & voting in the Security Council?

choices.answer: Yes
No

questions.question: Can the delegation of Taiwan be a moderator during a moderated caucus?

choices.answer: No, it has to vote
Yes, but only in the GA
Yes, all debating delegates have the right to moderate
No, only the P5 can moderate

questions.question: It is mandatory for delegates to interrupt when others speak in first person

choices.answer: Yes, rule 4.6 of the ROP says so
No, and please don't
True, all points may interrupt
False, only points of order may interrupt

questions.question: The main difference between points and motions is that points may interrupt the speaker
What is the motion to return to an agenda item previously discussed?

choices.answer: Motion to table agenda item
Motion to reconsider an agenda item
Motion to talk again about last topic
Motion to consider an agenda item
Yes, through a Point of Order (before voting)
Yes, through a point of Parliamentary Inquiry
No, once it's done, it's done
No, there has to be a vote

questions.question: Can a point or motion be withdrawn?
(Tip) How can you get rid of an unfriendly delegate easily?

choices.answer: Wait until he/she goes to the bathroom and establish quorum
Make him use his right of reply by insulting him
Point of order at everything he says and wait for a sanction
Provoke him, fake cry in front of his faculty and wait
